title: Can we have a mostly evil character that loves someone deeply?
body:
Love and romance are human nature. But it doesn't have to be only one type where 2 individuals love each other in the way that Xayah and Rakan have in their relationship. We have good examples of this, like:

{{champion:103}} x Her lover, which she killed unintentionally
{{champion:22}} x {{champion:23}} Looks complicated, and we aren't even sure if it is love or not. But it is complicated.
{{champion:420}} x {{champion:41}}  They loved and still love each other but they are apart now. It has a unique place in LoL.
{{champion:55}} x {{champion:86}} They are kinda Xayah and Rakan but seperated by their ideals and countries. Makes them unique.

Then we analyze we see, no champion that loved someone as far as we know in lore is undoubtly evil. Only character I could say evil is Gangplank and even he is nothing compare to our actual evil characters.

An evil character that has an obsession with only one person in the entire planet is something we lack. Could we have it? I think none of our characters are proper to it. It should be a new character. I wouldn't like Revenant Mordekaiser to have crush on someone.

VLAD. IS. NOT. A. VAMPIRE. PLEASE.

Yeah he's not a vampire but he's _League's_ vampire.  They will never make a vampire because Vlad was meant to cover that archetype.  Look at every single one of his skins.  Not a single skin of his neglects to portray a specific archetype of vampire.

Nosferatu: Fairly self-explanatory but also a whole vampire archetype unto itself
Count: A classic primary vampire archetype
Blood Lord: Your typical 'Blood Lord Kain' archetype
Soulstealer: Voodoo Swamp archetype popular in Magic the Gathering and other media
Academy: The "I'm a vampire blending into society and leading a normal life" archetype
Marquis: That Ye Olde Phantom of the Opera, very poetic and Jhin-like archetype
Vandal: Street Punk archetype, usually neophytes still drunk on their new vampire powers
Bilgewater: Vampirates.  It's a thing.  Just trust me on that one.

It's the same way that Anivia is our phoenix yet she clearly doesn't actually fit the part.  Vlad is not a vampire, but he's League's vampire.

What if there was a love interest for{{champion:202}} , {{champion:555}}, {{champion:27}}, or {{champion:6}} for example. 

It makes perfect sense as there are women and men who find dangerous people attractive. They would pay for their bail, send them money and gifts, write them letters, offer them a place to stay, prepare meals for them, marry that person , etc. Basically "Bonnie and Clyde Syndrome".

Plus there is a lot of ways to spin the story involving that love interest such as...
1) "Some believe they can change a man as cruel and powerful as a serial killer."
2) "Others 'see' the little boy that the killer once was and seek to nurture him."
3) "A few hoped to share in the media spotlight or get a book or movie deal."
4) "Then there's the notion of the 'perfect boyfriend'. She knows where he is at all times and she knows he's thinking about her. While she can claim that someone loves her, she does not have to endure the day-to-day issues involved in most relationships. There’s no laundry to do, no cooking for him, and no accountability to him. She can keep the fantasy charged up for a long time."

Someone for example who wants to share the spotlight with {{champion:202}}.

Someone who believes they can change and reform {{champion:555}}.

Someone who thinks they see the innocent side of {{champion:27}} and wants to nurture that side of him.

And finally just someone who wants the "perfect boyfriend" in someone like {{champion:6}} while not having to deal with the "day-to-day issues".
Yeah, Urgot is the big daddy.

I said it many times already and I will say it again.
Please give us a Chemtech augmented female from Zaun with a crazy obsession for Urgot.

She could even be the chembaron we are missing so badly.
Think about it, maybe she was a chembaron and encountered Urgot, but she survived (even if heavily wounded). And since she worships strength just as much as Urgot, she is obsessed with him.

She replaced her broken body parts with Chemtech and is now out killing people, to draw his attention and prove that she is "worthy".

This is something I've noticed in fantasy a lot. One of the defining characteristics of an evil character in most works is the inability to truly love another.(also the inability to have normal sex... but that's neither here nor there). Not entirely sure why... but for some reason people seem to have troubles envisioning an evil character loving someone.
